publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

altIdentifier.idno: Pelliot Koutchéen Compatibilité de monastère 35 [PK Cp 35]

seg.seg: In the 4th regnal year. On the 28th day of the 4th (month), Saṅkatāse of Paśarki gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, he ate himself. The other has been sold for 5 (coins).
On the 15th day, [Koraña] gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Miki[n]e took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). The other, Tātsi took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).

On the 16th day, the women of Ṣomoksa* gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Kercapiśke took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). The other, Śaṅke took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins).

On the 22nd day, the citizen Aṣtamikka*-women gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. They have been sold for coins (in sum): 10. The one, (Yarekke?) undertook (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).
Der Buddha erhielt zwei (2) Teile; je zu sechs wurden sie verkauft für zwölf (12) cāne's.
The Buddha received two (2) portions; at six each they were sold for twelve (12) cānes.
On the 23rd day, the citizen (and) the rural women gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2, (each sold) for five (coins). They have been sold for coins (in sum): 10.
On the last day of the month, Wrau of Olyīṣkā gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2, (each sold) for five (coins). They have been sold for coins (in sum): 10. [The month terminated.]

On the 15th day of the 6th (month), the people of Kalnīṅki gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Anandadewe took (by giving its price) as five (coins). The other, Wrau of Olyīśkā took (by giving its price) as [5] (coins).
On the 17th day, Korocciśka of [Olyīśkā] gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. Śiṅkācca took (it by giving its price) as 4 (coins).

On the 23rd day, Mpek Ccor gave food. [The portions (that) the Buddha obtained : 2. The one], [·u]ñ[ñ]ep took (by giving its price) as in 5 (coins). The other, Koñikka took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).

On the 24th day, Tarmaiśye('s women??) gave food. [The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one], Śiṅkācca took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). The other, Raktaswiñi took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).
On the last day of the month, Śiṅkācca gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: 1. Śiṅkācca took (it by giving its price) as 4 (coins). In the 7th month.

On the 2nd day of the 5th (month), Erkañciśke gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Kercapiśke took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). [The other, Raktaswiñi took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).]
On the 1st day, Ṣṣirecca gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Sijñātsi took (by giving its price) as four (coins). The other, Tātsi took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins).

On the 7th day of the month, the portions (that) the Buddha obtained: (.... one) [has been sold for four coins. Another, Śaṅke the Wärweśakke took (by giving its price) as four (coins). The (rest) one, Citraswiñi of Saṅkika* took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins).

On the 15th day, Koraña gave food. The portions (that) the Buddhas [obtained: four]. One, Śirmāṃñca took (by giving its price) as four (coins). Another, Raktaswiñi [took (by giving its price) as four (coins)]. Another, Kä[nm]äṅk took (by giving its price) as four (coins). The (last) one, Jñānasene took (by giving its price) as three (coins).
On the 22nd day, Śilasome made sarañi. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: 1. It has been sold for 3 (coins).

On the 23rd day, Ṣoṅk-seṃ gave food. The portion (that) the Buddhas obtained: 3. One, Yśiñātsi took (by giving its price) as four (coins). | Another, Puttikka took (by giving its price) as four (coins). | Another, Airkāca [took] (by giving its price) as four (coins). In total, (the price) in coins: 12. ///
Suklyike the Moko [took(?)] a portion ///
On the 27th day of the 10th (month), Cutte [gave food] ///
[4] (coins). The other, Caitike took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins).
On the 8th day of the 11th (month), Supriye of Teṅke gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. [I] gave the order to shave ... patsaśiś ... with (the cost of) this portion.
On the 15th day, Siñātsi [gave] food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: [2]. They have been sold. (Each sold) for five (coins, The total price) in coins: 10.
On the 8th day of the 12th (month), Wrau of Olyīśkā gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. It has been sold for 2 (coins). ///
On the 8th day of the month, Yśiñātsi gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Yśiñātsi took. The other, Kuṃñcakke took. (Each has been sold) for five (coins. The sum is) 10.
On the 19th day, Hkyauṅku gave food. ... [The Buddha] ... [has been sold] ... ///

On the 9th day of the month, Śaṅke of Ṣomoksa* gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Śilasome took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). The other, Jñānaciwe took (by giving its price) as 3 (coins).

On the 11th day, Suklyike's people gave food. [The portions] (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Cinatyuti took (by giving its price) as 3 (coins). The other, Räktāśka took (by giving its price) as 3 (coins).

p.note: Consisting of an alignment of four paper sheets of 38,2 cm (lines 1–13), 40 cm (lines 14–26), 37,1 cm (lines 27–39), and 36,5 cm height (lines 40–52).

a1-2 In the 4th regnal year. On the 28th day of the 4th (month), Saṅkatāse of Paśarki gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, he ate himself. The other has been sold for 5 (coins). a3-4 On the 2nd day of the 5th (month), Erkañciśke gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Kercapiśke took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). [The other, Raktaswiñi took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins).] a5-6 On the 8th day of the month, Yśiñātsi gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Yśiñātsi took. The other, Kuṃñcakke took. (Each has been sold) for five (coins. The sum is) 10. a7-8 On the 9th day of the month, Śaṅke of Ṣomoksa* gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Śilasome took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). The other, Jñānaciwe took (by giving its price) as 3 (coins). a9-10 On the 11th day, Suklyike's people gave food. [The portions] (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Cinatyuti took (by giving its price) as 3 (coins). The other, Räktāśka took (by giving its price) as 3 (coins). a11-12 On the 15th day, [Koraña] gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Miki[n]e took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). The other, Tātsi took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). a13-14 On the 16th day, the women of Ṣomoksa* gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Kercapiśke took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). The other, Śaṅke took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). a15-16 On the 22nd day, the citizen Aṣtamikka*-women gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. They have been sold for coins (in sum): 10. The one, (Yarekke?) undertook (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). a17-18 On the 23rd day, the citizen (and) the rural women gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2, (each sold) for five (coins). They have been sold for coins (in sum): 10. a19-20 On the last day of the month, Wrau of Olyīṣkā gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2, (each sold) for five (coins). They have been sold for coins (in sum): 10. [The month terminated.] a21-22 On the 15th day of the 6th (month), the people of Kalnīṅki gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Anandadewe took (by giving its price) as five (coins). The other, Wrau of Olyīśkā took (by giving its price) as [5] (coins). a23-24 On the 17th day, Korocciśka of [Olyīśkā] gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. Śiṅkācca took (it by giving its price) as 4 (coins). a25-26 On the 23rd day, Mpek Ccor gave food. [The portions (that) the Buddha obtained : 2. The one], [·u]ñ[ñ]ep took (by giving its price) as in 5 (coins). The other, Koñikka took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). a27-28 On the 24th day, Tarmaiśye('s women??) gave food. [The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one], Śiṅkācca took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). The other, Raktaswiñi took (by giving its price) as 5 (coins). a29-30 On the last day of the month, Śiṅkācca gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: 1. Śiṅkācca took (it by giving its price) as 4 (coins). In the 7th month. a31-32 On the 1st day, Ṣṣirecca gave food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: 2. The one, Sijñātsi took (by giving its price) as four (coins). The other, Tātsi took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). a33-34 On the 7th day of the month, the portions (that) the Buddha obtained: (.... one) [has been sold for four coins. Another, Śaṅke the Wärweśakke took (by giving its price) as four (coins). The (rest) one, Citraswiñi of Saṅkika* took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). a35-37 On the 15th day, Koraña gave food. The portions (that) the Buddhas [obtained: four]. One, Śirmāṃñca took (by giving its price) as four (coins). Another, Raktaswiñi [took (by giving its price) as four (coins)]. Another, Kä[nm]äṅk took (by giving its price) as four (coins). The (last) one, Jñānasene took (by giving its price) as three (coins). a38 On the 22nd day, Śilasome made sarañi. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: 1. It has been sold for 3 (coins). a39-41 On the 23rd day, Ṣoṅk-seṃ gave food. The portion (that) the Buddhas obtained: 3. One, Yśiñātsi took (by giving its price) as four (coins). | Another, Puttikka took (by giving its price) as four (coins). | Another, Airkāca [took] (by giving its price) as four (coins). In total, (the price) in coins: 12. /// a42 Suklyike the Moko [took(?)] a portion /// a43 On the 27th day of the 10th (month), Cutte [gave food] /// a44 [4] (coins). The other, Caitike took (by giving its price) as 4 (coins). a45-46 On the 8th day of the 11th (month), Supriye of Teṅke gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. [I] gave the order to shave ... patsaśiś ... with (the cost of) this portion. a47-48 On the 15th day, Siñātsi [gave] food. The portions (that) the Buddha obtained: [2]. They have been sold. (Each sold) for five (coins, The total price) in coins: 10. a49-50 On the 8th day of the 12th (month), Wrau of Olyīśkā gave food. The portion (that) the Buddha obtained: one. It has been sold for 2 (coins). /// a51-52 On the 19th day, Hkyauṅku gave food. ... [The Buddha] ... [has been sold] ... ///

a15-16 Der Buddha erhielt zwei (2) Teile; je zu sechs wurden sie verkauft für zwölf (12) cāne's. 250

śwersa | ṣeme airkāca kamā«te» a41 śwersa ṣe keśne cāneṃntsa śak wi 12 /// a42 moko suklyike pāke ka(m)ā(te) /// a43 śkañce ikäṃ ṣukne cutte śwāll(e |wasa) /// śwersa|(śwe)|rsa a44 4 ṣeme caitike kamāte św(e)rsa 4 a45 wärsaññe|wärsañe okt|ok meñantse -ne teṅkeṣṣe supriye śwālle wasa pañikte a46 pāke kalwa ṣeme cowak pākesa patsaśiś markasi yātkawa a47 pälletne siñātsi śwālle wa«sa» pañikte pakenta kalwa wi 2 {pl}äṅkāre a48 piśār cāneṃntsa śak 10 a49 rapaññe|rapañe okt|ok meñantse -ne olyīśkāṣe wrau śwālle wasa pañikte pāke kalwa|ka|lwa a50 ṣeme {pl}aṅka wisa 2 a51 śak ñune hkyauṅku śwālle wasa pañi(kte) /// plaṅka|(pla)|ṅka a52 b1 se ptamaṣṣe

div.p:
Alternative classifications:

Please check: tānesa =?= , olyīśkāṣṣe =?= olyiṣkāṣṣe "prtng to [a fruit of some sort?]"; ṣeme ya – [kk]· =?= ṣeme y(śiñā)[ts](i). –Martin (Mon, 2019-01-21, 16:09:02 (CET))
